page.title: 07EDUCATION IN N.BRISTOL
page.content: Nine Primary schools serve a broad social mix & contain nine special classes for remedial education. These feed into three Secondary state schools with progression to Further Education outside the area.Greenway Boys' School has recently closed due to falling rolls.Pen Park Girls' still remains a single sex school. There is a school for severely sub normal children at Henbury Manor, Stokesbrook Special School,a school for the deaf at Elmfield in Westbury & the Lanercost Training Centre in Southmead for mentally handicapped adults.There is an independent college for training Methodist ministers at Henbury & an adult education centre at Westbury-on-Trym.Some children move outside the area to be educated at independent schools.
